8.verse: He said to them, “Because of the hardness of your heart, Moses allowed you to divorce your wives. But from the beginning it was not so.

9.verse: “Therefore, I say to you that whoever shall divorce his wife and marry another, unless it is for promiscuity, commits adultery. And whoever marries a divorcee ́, commits adultery.”

10.verse: His disciples said to Him, “If it is so between man and wife, it is not good to marry.”

11.verse: But He said to them, “All men cannot receive this thing. Only those to whom it is given.

12.verse: “For there are some eunuchs who were so born from their mother’s belly. And there are some eunuchs who are gelded by men. And there be some eunuchs who have gelded themselves for the Kingdom of Heaven. The one who is able to receive this, let him receive it.”

13.verse: Then little children were brought to Him, so that He could put hands on them and pray. And the disciples rebuked them.

14.verse: But Jesus said, “Allow the little children. And do not forbid them to come to Me. For of such is the Kingdom of Heaven.”

15.verse: And when He had put His hands on them, He departed from there.

16.verse: And behold, one came and said to Him, “Good Master, what good thing shall I do, so that I may have eternal life?

17.verse: And He said to him, “Why did you call me good? There is no one good, but One, even God. But if you wish to enter into Life, keep the Commandments.”

18.verse: “He said to Him, “Which?” And Jesus said, “These: ‘You shall not kill’. ‘You shall not commit adultery’. ‘You shall not steal’. ‘You shall not bear false witness’.

19.verse: “‘Honor your father and mother’. And, ‘You shall love your neighbor as yourself’.”

20.verse: The young man said to Him, “I have observed all these things from my youth. “What do I still lack?”

21.verse: Jesus said to him, “If you wish to be perfect, go. Sell what you have and give it to the poor. And you shall have treasure in Heaven. And come and follow Me.”

22.verse: And when the young man heard that saying, he went away sorrowful. For he had great possessions.

23.verse: Then Jesus said to His disciples, “Truly I say to you that a rich man shall not easily enter into the Kingdom of Heaven.

24.verse: “And again I say to you it is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle than for a rich man to enter into the Kingdom of God.”

25.verse: And when His disciples heard it, they were exceedingly amazed, saying, “Who then can be saved?”

26.verse: And Jesus looked at them, and said to them, “With men this is impossible. But with God, all things are possible.”

27.verse: Then Peter answered, and said to Him, “Behold, we have forsaken all, and followed You. What, therefore, shall we have?”

28.verse: And Jesus said to them, “Truly I say to you that when the Son of Man shall sit on the throne of His Majesty, you who followed Me in the new birth shall also sit upon twelve thrones, and judge the twelve tribes of Israel.

29.verse: “And whoever shall forsake houses, or brothers, or sisters, or father, or mother, or wife, or children, or lands, for My Name’s sake, shall receive a hundredfold more, and shall inherit everlasting life.

30.verse: “But many that are first, shall be last. And the last shall be first.

1.verse: “For the Kingdom of Heaven is like a certain landowner, who went out at the dawning of the day to hire laborers into his vineyard.

2.verse: “And he agreed with the laborers for a penny a day and sent them into his vineyard.

3.verse: “And he went out about the third hour, and saw others standing idle in the marketplace,

4.verse: “and said to them, “You go into my vineyard also. And whatever is right, I will give you. And they went their way.

5.verse: “Again, he went out about the sixth and ninth hour, and did likewise.

6.verse: “And he went about the eleventh hour, and found others standing idle, and said to them, ‘Why do you stand here idle all day?’

7.verse: “They said to him, ‘Because no one has hired us.’ He said to them, ‘You go into my vineyard also. And whatever is right, that shall you receive.’

8.verse: “And when evening had come, the master of the vineyard said to his steward, ‘Call the laborers and give them their wages, beginning at the last, till you come to the first.’

9.verse: “And those who were hired about the eleventh hour, came. And each received a penny.

10.verse: “Now when the first came, they assumed that they would receive more. But each of them also received a penny.

11.verse: “And when they had received it, they murmured against the master of the house,

12.verse: “saying, ‘These last have only worked one hour, and you have made them equal to us, who have borne the burden and heat of the day!’

13.verse: “And he answered one of them, saying, ‘Friend, I do you no wrong. Did you not agree with me for a penny?

14.verse: ‘Take that which is yours and go your way. I will give to this last as much as to you.

15.verse: ‘Is it not lawful for me to do as I will with my own? Is your eye evil because I am good?’

16.verse: “So the last shall be first, and the first last. For many are called, but few chosen.”

17.verse: And Jesus went up to Jerusalem, and took the twelve disciples aside on the way and said to them,

18.verse: “Behold, we go up to Jerusalem. And the Son of Man shall be delivered to the chief priests, and to the scribes. And they shall condemn Him to death,

19.verse: “and shall deliver Him to the Gentiles - to mock, and to scourge, and to crucify. But the third day, He shall rise again.”

20.verse: Then the mother of Zebedee’s children came to Him with her sons, worshipping, and desiring a certain thing of Him.

21.verse: “And he said to her, “What do you wish?” She said to him, “Grant that these, my two sons, may sit - the one at Your right hand and the other at Your left hand - in Your Kingdom.”

22.verse: And Jesus answered, and said, “Ye do not know what you ask. Are you able to drink from the cup from which I shall drink, and to be baptized with the baptism with which I shall be baptized? They said to Him, “We are able.”

23.verse: And He said to them, “You shall indeed drink from My cup, and shall be baptized with the baptism with which I am baptized. But to sit at My right hand, and at My left hand, is not Mine to give. But it shall be given to those for whom it is prepared by My Father.”

24.verse: And when the other ten heard this, they were angry at the two brothers.

25.verse: Therefore Jesus called them to Him, and said, “You know that the rulers of the Gentiles lord it over them. And those who are great, exercise authority over them.

26.verse: “But it shall not be so among you. But whoever will be great among you, let him be your servant.

27.verse: “And whoever will be chief among you, let him be your servant;

28.verse: “just as the Son of Man did not come to be served, but to serve, and to give His life for the ransom of many.”

29.verse: And as they departed from Jericho, a great multitude followed Him.

30.verse: And behold, two blind men, sitting by the roadside, when they heard that Jesus passed by, cried, saying, “O Lord, the Son of David! Have mercy on us!”

31.verse: And the multitude rebuked them, that they should hold their peace. But they cried all the more, saying, “O Lord! The Son of David! Have mercy on us!”

32.verse: Then Jesus stood still, and called them, and said, “What would you have Me do to you?

33.verse: They said to Him, “Lord, that our eyes may be opened!”

34.verse: And Jesus, moved with compassion, touched their eyes. And immediately their eyes received sight. And they followed Him.

1.verse: And when they drew near to Jerusalem, and had come to Bethphage, to the mount of the Olives. Then Jesus sent two disciples,

2.verse: saying to them, “Go into the town in front of you, and soon you shall find a donkey bound, and a colt with her. Untie them and bring them to Me.

3.verse: “And if anyone says anything to you, say that the Lord has need of them. And immediately he will let them go.”

4.verse: All this was done that what was spoken by the Prophet might be fulfilled, which says,

5.verse: “Tell the daughter of Zion, ‘Behold, your King comes to you, meek and sitting upon a donkey; and upon a colt, the foal of a beast of burden’.”

6.verse: So the disciples went and did as Jesus had commanded them;

7.verse: and brought the donkey and the colt, and put their garments on them, and set Him upon it.

8.verse: And a great multitude spread their garments in the way. And others cut down branches from the trees and strew them in the way.

9.verse: Moreover, the people who went before, as well as those who followed, cried, saying, “Hosanna to the Son of David! Blessed is He Who comes in the Name of the Lord! Hosanna, in the highest!”

10.verse: And when He had come into Jerusalem, all the city was stirred up, saying, “Who is this?”

11.verse: And the people said, “This is Jesus, that Prophet of Nazareth in Galilee.”

12.verse: And Jesus went into the Temple of God, and cast out all those who sold and bought in the Temple; and overthrew the tables of the moneychangers, and the seats of those who sold doves;

13.verse: and said to them, “It is written! My house shall be called the House of Prayer! But you have made it a den of thieves!”

14.verse: Then the blind and the lame came to Him in the Temple. And He healed them.

15.verse: But when the chief priests and scribes saw the wonders that He did, and the children crying in the Temple, and saying, “Hosanna to the Son of David”, they were angry,

16.verse: and said to Him, “Do You hear what they say?” And Jesus said to them, “Yes. Have you never read, ‘By the mouth of children and infants You have made perfect the praise’?”

17.verse: So He left them and went out of the city, to Bethany, and lodged there.

18.verse: And in the morning, as He returned into the city, He was hungry.

19.verse: And seeing a fig tree on the way, He came to it. And finding nothing on it but leaves, He said to it, “May fruit never grow on you again.” And immediately the fig tree withered.

20.verse: And when His disciples saw it, they marveled, saying, “How quickly that fig tree withered!”

21.verse: And Jesus answered and said to them, “Truly I say to you, if you have faith and do not doubt, you shall not only do this to the fig tree, but it shall also be done if you say to this mountain, ‘Take yourself away, and cast yourself into the sea’.

22.verse: “And whatever you shall ask in prayer - if you believe - you shall receive it.”

23.verse: And when He had come into the Temple, the chief priests and the elders of the people came to Him as He was teaching, and said, “By what authority do You do these things? And who gave You this authority?”

24.verse: Then Jesus answered, and said to them, “I will also ask of you a certain thing which, if you tell me, I will likewise tell you by what authority I do these things.

25.verse: “The baptism of John. From where did it come - from Heaven or from men?” Then they reasoned among themselves, saying, “If we shall say, ‘From Heaven’, He will say to us, ‘Why then did you not believe him?’

26.verse: “And if we say, ‘From men’, we fear the multitude.” For all held John as a Prophet.

27.verse: Then they answered Jesus, and said, “We cannot tell.” And He said to them, “Nor will I tell you by what authority I do these things.

28.verse: “But what do you think? A man had two sons, and came to the elder, and said, ‘Son, go and work today in my vineyard.’

29.verse: “But he answered, and said, ‘I will not.’ But later he changed his mind and went.

30.verse: “Then he came to the second and said likewise. And he answered, and said, ‘I will, sir.’ But he did not go.

31.verse: “Which of the two did the will of the father?” They said to Him, “The first.” Jesus said to them, “Truly I say to you that the tax collectors and the prostitutes go before you into the Kingdom of God.

32.verse: “For John came to you in the way of righteousness, and you did not believe him. But the tax collectors and the prostitutes believed him. And you, though you saw it, were not moved with repentance afterward, so that you might believe him.

33.verse: “Hear another parable. There was a certain landowner who planted a vineyard and fenced it in. And he made a winepress therein, and built a tower, and let it out to tenant farmers, and went away to a strange country.

34.verse: “And when the time of the fruit drew near, he sent his servants to the farmers to receive the fruits thereof.

35.verse: “And the farmers took his servants and beat one, killed another, and stoned another.

36.verse: “Again, he sent other servants (more than the first) and they did likewise to them.

37.verse: “But last of all he sent his own son to them, saying, ‘They will revere my son’.

38.verse: “But when the farmers saw the son, they said among themselves, ‘This is the heir. Come, let us kill him. And let us take his inheritance.’

39.verse: “So they took him, and cast him out of the vineyard, and killed him.

40.verse: “Therefore, when the Lord of the vineyard shall come, what will he do to those farmers?”

41.verse: They said to Him, “He will cruelly destroy those wicked men, and will let out his vineyard to other farmers who shall deliver the fruits to him in their seasons.”

42.verse: Jesus said to them, “Have you never read in the Scriptures, ‘The stone which the builders refused, the same is made the Cornerstone. This was the Lord’s doing, and it is marvelous in our eyes’?

43.verse: “Therefore I say to you the Kingdom of God shall be taken from you and shall be given to a nation which shall bring forth the fruits thereof.

44.verse: “And the one who shall fall on this stone, shall be broken. But on whomever it shall fall, it will grind to powder.

45.verse: And when the chief priests and Pharisees had heard His parables, they perceived that He spoke of them.

46.verse: And they, seeking to lay hands on Him, feared the people. Because they took Him as a Prophet.

1.verse: Then Jesus answered, and spoke to them again in parables, saying,

2.verse: “The Kingdom of Heaven is like a certain king who made a marriage feast for his son.

3.verse: “And he sent forth his servants to call those who were invited to the wedding. But they would not come.

4.verse: “Again, he sent forth other servants, saying, ‘Tell those who are invited, “Behold, I have prepared my dinner. My oxen and my fatted calves are killed, and all things are ready. Come to the marriage”.’

5.verse: “But they made light of it, and went their ways - one to his farm, and another about his business.

6.verse: “And the rest took his servants, and treated them sharply, and killed them.

7.verse: “But when the king heard it, he was angry, and sent forth his warriors, and destroyed those murderers, and burnt up their city.

8.verse: “Then he said to his servants, ‘Truly the wedding is prepared. But those who were invited were not worthy.

9.verse: “‘Therefore, go out into the streets. And as many as you find, invite them to the marriage.’

10.verse: “So those servants went out into the streets, and gathered together everyone they found, both good and bad. So, the wedding was furnished with guests.

11.verse: “Then the king came in to see the guests and saw a man there who did not have on a wedding garment.

12.verse: “And he said to him, ‘Friend, how did you get in here without a wedding garment?’ And he was speechless.

13.verse: “Then the king said to the servants, “Bind him hand and foot. Take him away and cast him into the outer darkness. There shall be weeping and gnashing of teeth.

14.verse: “For many are called, but few chosen.”

15.verse: Then the Pharisees went and took counsel how they might trap Him in talk.

16.verse: And they sent their disciples to Him, with the Herodians, saying, “Master, we know that You are true, and teach the way of God truly. Nor do You care for anyone. For You do not look on the appearance of men.

17.verse: “Therefore, tell us what You think. Is it lawful to pay taxes to Caesar, or not?”

18.verse: But Jesus perceived their wickedness, and said, “Why do you test Me, hypocrites?

19.verse: “Show Me the money for the tribute.” And they brought Him a coin.

20.verse: And He said to them, “Whose image and inscription are these?”

21.verse: They said to Him, “Caesar’s”. Then He said to them, “Therefore, give to Caesar those things which are Caesar’s. And give to God those things which are God’s.”

22.verse: And when they heard it, they marveled, and left Him, and went their way.

23.verse: The same day, the Sadducees (who say that there is no resurrection) came to Him and asked Him,

24.verse: saying, “Master, Moses said, ‘If a man dies having no children, his brother shall marry his wife and raise up seed to his brother.’

25.verse: “Now there were with us seven brothers. And the first married a wife and died. And having no offspring, left his wife to his brother.

26.verse: “Likewise also the second, and the third, up to the seventh.

27.verse: “And last of all, the woman died also.

28.verse: “Therefore, in the resurrection, whose wife shall she be of the seven? For all had her.”

29.verse: Then Jesus answered, and said to them, “You are deceived, not knowing the Scriptures, nor the power of God.

30.verse: “For in the resurrection they neither marry wives, nor are wives bestowed in marriage. But they are as the angels of God in Heaven.

31.verse: “And concerning the resurrection of the dead, have you not read what is spoken to you from God, saying,

32.verse: “‘I am the God of Abraham, and the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob’? God is not the God of the dead, but of the living.”

33.verse: And when the multitude heard it, they were astonished at His doctrine.

34.verse: But when the Pharisees had heard that He had silenced the Sadducees, they assembled together.

35.verse: And one of them, an expounder of the Law, asked Him a question, tempting Him, and saying,

36.verse: “Master, which is the greatest Commandment in the Law?

37.verse: Jesus said to him, “You shall love the Lord your God with all thine heart, with all your soul, and with all your mind.

38.verse: “This is the first and the greatest Commandment.

39.verse: “And the second is like this, “You shall love your neighbor as yourself.

40.verse: “On these two Commandments hang the whole Law and the Prophets.”

41.verse: While the Pharisees were gathered together, Jesus asked them,

42.verse: saying, “What do you think of Christ? Whose son is He?” They said to him, “David’s.”

43.verse: He said to them, “How then does David, in spirit, call Him ‘Lord’, saying,

44.verse: ‘The Lord said to my Lord, “Sit at my right hand, till I make Your enemies Your footstool?

45.verse: If, then, David calls Him Lord, how is He his son?

46.verse: And no one could answer Him a word. Nor did anyone ask Him any more questions from that day forth.

1.verse: Then Jesus spoke to the multitude, and to His disciples,

2.verse: saying, “The scribes and the Pharisees sit in Moses’ seat.

3.verse: “Therefore, all of whatever they ask you to observe, observe and do. But do not imitate their deeds, for they do not do as they say.

4.verse: “For they bind heavy burdens, and hard to bear, and lay them on men’s shoulders. But they themselves will not lift a finger to move them.

5.verse: “They do all their works to be seen by men. For they make their phylacteries broad, and the fringes of their garments long.

6.verse: “And they love the chief place at feasts, and to have the chief seats in the assemblies;

7.verse: “and greetings in the markets, and to be called by men, ‘Rabbi, Rabbi.’

8.verse: “But do not be called, ‘Rabbi’. For One is your Master - Christ, and all of you are brothers.

9.verse: “And call no man your father upon the earth. For there is but One, your Father Who is in Heaven.

10.verse: “Do not be called ‘Masters’. For One is your Master - Christ.

11.verse: “But the one who is greatest among you, let him be your servant.

12.verse: “For whoever will exalt himself shall be brought low. And whoever will humble himself shall be exalted.

13.verse: “Therefore, woe to you, scribes and Pharisees. Hypocrites! Because you shut up the Kingdom of Heaven before men. For you yourselves do not go in, nor do you allow those who wish entrance to come in.

14.verse: “Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees. Hypocrites! For you devour widows’ houses, even under a pretense of long prayers. Therefore, you shall receive the greater damnation.

15.verse: “Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, Hypocrites! For you traverse sea and land to make one proselyte. And when he is made, you make him twofold more a child of hell than you yourselves!

16.verse: “Woe to you, blind guides, who say, ‘Whoever swears by the Temple, it is nothing. But whoever swears by the gold of the Temple, he sins.’

17.verse: “You fools, and blind! Which is greater, the gold or the Temple that sanctifies the gold?

18.verse: “And, ‘Whoever swears by the altar, it is nothing. But whoever swears by the offering upon it, sins.’

19.verse: “You fools, and blind! Which is greater, the offering or the altar which sanctifies the offering?

20.verse: “Therefore, whoever swears by the altar, swears by it and by all things thereupon.

21.verse: “And whoever swears by the Temple, swears by it and by Him Who dwells therein.

22.verse: “And the one who swears by Heaven, swears by the throne of God and by Him Who sits thereupon.

23.verse: “Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, Hypocrites! For you tithe mint and anise and cumin, and leave the weightier matters of the law, judgment, and mercy and fidelity. These you ought to have done, and not to have left the other.

24.verse: You blind guides, who strain out a gnat and swallow a camel!

25.verse: “Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, Hypocrites! For you make clean the outside of the cup and the platter. But inside they are full of bribery and excess.

26.verse: “You blind Pharisee! First, cleanse the inside of the cup and platter, so that the outside of them may be clean also.

27.verse: “Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, Hypocrites! For you are like whitened tombs which appear beautiful outside, but inside are full of dead men’s bones and all filthiness.

28.verse: “So are you also. For outward you appear righteous to men, but within you are full of hypocrisy and iniquity.

29.verse: “Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, Hypocrites! For you build the tombs of the Prophets, and garnish the sepulchers of the righteous,

30.verse: “and say, ‘If we had lived in the days of our fathers, we would not have been partners with them in the blood of the Prophets.’

31.verse: “So then you are witnesses to yourselves that you are the children of those who murdered the Prophets.

32.verse: “And you fill up the measure of your fathers.

33.verse: “O serpents! The generation of vipers! How shall you escape the damnation of Hell!

34.verse: “Therefore, behold, I send to you Prophets, and wise men, and scribes. And some of them you shall kill and crucify. And some of them you shall scourge in your synagogues and persecute from city to city.

35.verse: “So that upon you may come all the righteous blood that was shed upon the earth, from the blood of Abel the righteous to the blood of Zechariah the son of Berechiah, whom you killed between the Temple and the altar.

36.verse: “Truly I say to you that all these things shall come upon this generation.

37.verse: “Jerusalem, Jerusalem; who kills the Prophets and stones those who are sent to you! How often would I have gathered your children together - as the hen gathers her chickens under her wings - and you would not!

38.verse: “Behold, your house shall be left to you desolate.

39.verse: “For I say to you, you shall not see Me again until you say, ‘Blessed is the One Who comes in the Name of the Lord’.”

1.verse: And Jesus went out and departed from the Temple. And His disciples came to Him to show Him the building of the Temple.

2.verse: And Jesus said to them, “Do you not see all these things? Truly I say to you, there shall not be left a stone upon a stone here, that shall not be cast down.”

3.verse: And as He sat upon the Mount of Olives, His disciples came to Him alone, saying, “Tell us when these things shall be. And what sign shall there be of Your coming, and of the end of the world?”

4.verse: And Jesus answered, and said to them, “See to it that no one deceives you.

5.verse: “For many shall come in My Name, saying, ‘I am Christ’, and shall deceive many.

6.verse: “And you shall hear of wars, and rumors of wars. See that you are not troubled. For all these things must happen. But the end is not yet.

7.verse: “For nation shall rise against nation, and realm against realm. And there shall be famine, and pestilence, and earthquakes in diverse places.

8.verse: “All these are but the beginning of sorrows.

9.verse: “Then they shall deliver you up to tribulation and shall kill you. And you shall be hated by all nations, for My Name’s sake.

10.verse: “And then shall many be offended, and shall betray one another, and shall hate one another.

11.verse: “And many false prophets shall arise and shall deceive many.

12.verse: “And because iniquity shall be increased, the love of many shall be cold.

13.verse: “But the one who endures to the end, he shall be saved.

14.verse: “And this Gospel of the Kingdom shall be preached through the whole world, for a witness to all nations. And then the end shall come.

15.verse: “Therefore, when you shall see the Abomination of Desolation (spoken of by Daniel the Prophet) set in the Holy Place (let the one who reads consider it.)

16.verse: “Then let those who are in Judea, flee into the mountains.

17.verse: “Let the one who is on the housetop, not come down to fetch anything out of his house.

18.verse: “And the one who is in the field, let him not go back to fetch his clothes.

19.verse: “Then woe to those who are with child, and to those who give suck in those days.

20.verse: “But pray that your flight is not in the winter, nor on the Sabbath.

21.verse: “For then shall be great tribulation, such as was not from the beginning of the world to this time, nor shall be.

22.verse: “And unless those days are shortened, no flesh will be saved. But for the Elect’s sake, those days shall be shortened.

23.verse: “Then, if anyone shall say to you, ‘Lo, here (or there) is Christ’, do not believe it.

24.verse: “For there shall arise false christs, and false prophets, and shall show great signs and wonders. So that if it were possible, they would deceive the very Elect.

25.verse: “Behold, I have told you before.

26.verse: “Therefore, if they shall say to you, ‘Behold, He is in the desert’, do not go. ‘Behold, He is in the secret places’, do not believe it.

27.verse: “For as the lightning comes out of the east, and is seen in the west, so also shall the coming of the Son of Man be.

28.verse: “For wherever a dead carcass is, there will the eagles be gathered together.

29.verse: “And immediately after the tribulations of those days, the sun shall be darkened. And the moon shall not give her light. And the stars shall fall from Heaven. And the powers of Heaven shall be shaken.

30.verse: “And then the sign of the Son of Man shall appear in Heaven. And then all the tribes of the earth shall mourn. And they shall see the Son of Man come in the clouds of Heaven with power and great glory.

31.verse: And He shall send his angels with a great sound of a trumpet. And they shall gather together His Elect from the four winds - from the one end of the heavens to the other.

32.verse: “Now learn the parable of the fig tree. When her bough is still tender, and it puts forth leaves, you know that summer is near.

33.verse: “So likewise, when you see all these things, know that the Kingdom of God is near, even at the doors.

34.verse: “Truly I say to you that this generation shall not pass until all these things are done.

35.verse: “Heaven and Earth shall pass away. But My words shall not pass away.

36.verse: “But of that day and hour knows no one; no, not the angels of Heaven, but only My Father.

37.verse: “But as in the days of Noah, so likewise shall be the coming of the Son of Man.

38.verse: “For as in the days before the flood, they ate and drank, married, and gave in marriage, until the day that Noah entered into the Ark.

39.verse: “And they knew nothing until the flood came and took them all away. So also shall the coming of the Son of Man be.

40.verse: “Then two shall be in the fields. The one shall be received, and the other shall be refused.

41.verse: “Two women shall be grinding at the mill. The one shall be received, and the other shall be refused.

42.verse: “Watch, therefore. For you do not know what hour your Master will come.

43.verse: “Of this be sure: that if the good man of the house knew at what time the thief would come, he would surely watch, and not allow his house to be dug through.

44.verse: “Therefore, you be ready also. For the Son of Man will come at an hour which you do not expect.

45.verse: “Who then is a faithful servant (and wise), whom his master has made ruler over his household, to give them food in season?

46.verse: “Blessed is that servant whom his master, when he comes, shall find so doing.

47.verse: “Truly I say to you that he shall make him ruler over all his goods.

48.verse: “But if that evil servant shall say in his heart, ‘My master delays his coming’,

49.verse: “and begins to beat his fellow servants, and to eat and drink with the drunken,

50.verse: “that servant’s master will come on a day when he is not looking for him, and at an hour of which he is not aware,

51.verse: “and will cut him in two and give him his portion with the hypocrites. There shall be weeping and gnashing of teeth.”

1.verse: “Then the Kingdom of Heaven shall be likened to ten virgins, who took their lamps and went forth to meet the bridegroom.

2.verse: “And five of them were wise, and five foolish.

3.verse: “The foolish took their lamps but took no oil with them.

4.verse: “But the wise took oil in their flasks with their lamps.

5.verse: “Now, while the bridegroom was delayed, they all slumbered and slept.

6.verse: “And at midnight there was a cry made, ‘Behold, the bridegroom comes! Go out to meet him!’

7.verse: “Then all those virgins arose and trimmed their lamps.

8.verse: “And the foolish said to the wise, ‘Give us some of your oil. For our lamps are out.’

9.verse: “But the wise answered, saying, ‘No, for there will not be enough for us and you. Rather, go to the market and buy some for yourselves.

10.verse: “And while they went to buy, the bridegroom came. And those who were ready went in with him to the wedding. And the gate was shut.

11.verse: “Afterwards the other virgins also came, saying, ‘Lord! Lord! Open up for us!’

12.verse: “But he answered, and said, ‘Truly I say to you, I do not know you.’

13.verse: “Therefore, watch. For you know neither the day nor the hour when the Son of Man will come.

14.verse: “For the Kingdom of Heaven is as a man who, going into a strange country, called his servants and handed over his goods to them.

15.verse: “And to one he gave five talents, and to another two, and to another one, each according to his own ability. And immediately he left home.

16.verse: “Then the one who had received the five talents, went and traded with them, and gained another five talents.

17.verse: “Likewise also, the one who received two, gained another two.

18.verse: “But the one who received the one, went and buried it in the earth, and hid his master’s money.

19.verse: “But after a long season, the master of those servants came and settled with them.

20.verse: “Then the one who had received five talents came, and brought another five talents, saying, ‘Master, you handed over to me five talents. Behold, I have gained another five more talents with them.’

21.verse: “Then his master said to him, ‘Well done, good and faithful servant. You have been faithful in little. I will make you ruler over much. Enter into your master’s joy.’

22.verse: “Also, the one who had received two talents came, and said, ‘Master, you handed over to me two talents. Behold, I have gained another two talents more.’

23.verse: “His master said to him, ‘Well done, good and faithful servant. You have been faithful in little. I will make you ruler over much. Enter into your master’s joy.’

24.verse: “Then the one who had received the one talent came, and said, ‘Master, I knew that you were a hard man, who reaps where you do not sow, and gathers where you do not scatter.

25.verse: ‘Therefore, I was afraid, and went and hid your talent in the earth. Behold, you have what is yours.’

26.verse: “And his master answered, and said to him, ‘You evil and slothful servant! You knew that I reap where I did not sow and gather where I did not scatter.

27.verse: “‘Therefore, you ought to have put my money in the bank. And then at my coming I would have received my own with interest.

28.verse: “‘Therefore, take the talent from him and give it to him who has ten talents.

29.verse: “‘For to everyone who has, it shall be given, and he shall have abundance. But from the one who has not, even that he has shall be taken away.

30.verse: “‘Therefore, cast that unprofitable servant into the outer darkness. There shall be weeping and gnashing of teeth.’

31.verse: “And when the Son of Man comes in His glory and all the holy angels with Him, then He shall sit upon the throne of His glory,

32.verse: “And all nations shall be gathered before Him, and He shall separate them one from another, as a shepherd separates the sheep from the goats.

33.verse: “And He shall set the sheep on his right hand and the goats on the left.

34.verse: “Then the king shall say to those on his right hand, ‘Come you blessed of My Father. Take the inheritance of the Kingdom, prepared for you from the foundation of the world.

35.verse: “‘For I was hungry, and you gave Me food. I thirsted, and you gave Me drink. I was a stranger, and you took Me in to you.

36.verse: “‘I was naked, and you clothed Me. I was sick, and you visited Me. I was in prison, and you came to Me.’

37.verse: “Then the righteous shall answer him, saying, ‘Lord, when did we see You hungry and feed You; or thirsty and give You drink?

38.verse: “‘And when did we see You as a stranger and take You in to us; or naked and clothe You?

39.verse: “‘Or when did we see You sick, or in prison, and come to You?’

40.verse: “And the king shall answer, and say to them, ‘Truly I say to you, inasmuch as you have done it to one of the least of these, My brothers, you have done it to Me.’

41.verse: “Then He shall say to those on the left hand, ‘Depart from Me you cursed, into everlasting fire, which is prepared for the devil and his angels.

42.verse: “‘For I was hungry, and you gave Me no food. I thirsted, and you gave Me no drink.

43.verse: “‘I was a stranger, and you did not take Me in to you. I was naked, and you did not clothe Me; sick, and in prison, and you did not visit Me.’

44.verse: “Then they shall answer Him, saying, ‘Lord, when did we see you hungry; or thirsty, or a stranger, or naked, or sick, or in prison, and did not minister to You?’

45.verse: “Then He shall answer them, and say, ‘Truly I say to you, inasmuch as you did not do it to one of the least of these, you did not do it to Me.’

46.verse: “And these shall go into everlasting pain, and the righteous into life eternal.”

1.verse: And it came to pass, when Jesus had finished all these sayings, He said to His disciples,

2.verse: “You know that after two days is the Passover, and the Son of Man shall be delivered to be crucified.”

3.verse: Then the chief priests and the scribes and the elders of the people gathered together into the hall of the High Priest Caiaphas.

4.verse: And they plotted together how they might take Jesus by deceit and kill Him.

5.verse: But they said, “Not at the feast, lest any uproar be among the people.”

6.verse: And when Jesus was in Bethany, in the house of Simon the leper,

7.verse: a woman came to Him with a box of very costly ointment and poured it on His head as He sat at the table.

8.verse: And when His disciples saw it, they were indignant, saying, “Why this waste?

9.verse: “For this ointment might have been sold for much and been given to the poor.”

10.verse: And Jesus, knowing it, said to them, “Why do you trouble the woman? For she has done a good work for Me.

11.verse: “For you have the poor with you always. But Me you shall not have always.

12.verse: “For in pouring this ointment on My body, she did it for My burial.

13.verse: “Truly I say to you, wherever this Gospel shall be preached throughout all the world, this that she has done shall also be spoken of, as a memorial of her.”

14.verse: Then one of the twelve, called Judas Iscariot, went to the chief priests,

15.verse: and said, “What will you give me to deliver Him to you?” And they gave him thirty pieces of silver.

16.verse: And from that time, he sought an opportunity to betray Him.

17.verse: Now on the first day of the Feast of Unleavened Bread, the disciples came to Jesus, saying to Him, “Where would You like us to prepare for You to eat the Passover?”

18.verse: And He said, “Go into the city to a certain man, and say to him, ‘The Master says, “My time is at hand. I will keep the Passover at your house with My disciples”.’”

19.verse: And the disciples did as Jesus had told them and made ready the Passover.

20.verse: And when evening came, He sat down with the twelve.

21.verse: And as they ate, He said, “Truly I say to you that one of you shall betray Me.”

22.verse: And they were exceedingly sorrowful, and each one of them began say to Him, “Is it me, Master!?”

23.verse: And He answered and said, “The one who dipped his hand in the dish with Me, he shall betray Me.

24.verse: “Surely the Son of Man goes his way, as it is written of Him. But woe to that man by whom the Son of Man is betrayed. It had been good for that man if he had never been born.”

25.verse: “Then Judas (who betrayed Him) answered, and said, “Is it me, Master?” He said to him, “You have said it.”

26.verse: And as they ate, Jesus took the bread. And when He had blessed it, He broke it, and gave it to the disciples, and said, “Take. Eat. This is My body.”

27.verse: Also He took the cup. And when He had given thanks, He gave it to them, saying, “Drink all of it.

28.verse: “For this is My blood of the New Testament, which is shed for many, for the remission of sins.

29.verse: “I say to you that I will not drink from the fruit of the vine again until that Day when I shall drink it new with you in my Father’s Kingdom.”

30.verse: And when they had sung a Psalm, they went out to the Mount of Olives.

31.verse: Then said Jesus to them, “All of you will fall away from Me this night. For it is written, ‘I will strike the Shepherd, and the sheep of the flock shall be scattered.’

32.verse: “But after I am risen again, I will go before you into Galilee.”

33.verse: But Peter answered, and said to Him, “Even if all should fall away from You, I will never fall away.”

34.verse: Jesus said to him, “Truly I say to you that this night, before the cock crows, you shall deny Me three times.

35.verse: Peter said to Him, “Even if I should die with You, I would in no way deny You!” And so also said all the disciples.

36.verse: Then Jesus went with them into a place called Gethsemane, and said to His disciples, “Sit here, while I go and pray over there.”

37.verse: And He took Peter and the two sons of Zebedee with Him; and began to be sorrowful, and greatly distressed.

38.verse: Then Jesus said to them, “My soul is very heavy, even to the death. Wait here, and watch with Me.”

39.verse: So He went a little further, and fell on His face, and prayed, saying, “O, My Father. If it is possible, let this cup pass from Me. Nevertheless, not as I will, but as You will.”

40.verse: Afterward, He came to the disciples, and found them asleep, and said to Peter, “What?! Could you not watch with Me one hour?!

41.verse: “Watch, and pray, so that you do not enter into temptation. The spirit is indeed ready, but the flesh is weak.”

42.verse: Again He went away a second time, and prayed, saying, “O, My Father! If this cup cannot pass away from Me unless I drink it, Your will be done.”

43.verse: And He came and found them asleep again, for their eyes were heavy.

44.verse: So He left them, and went away again, and prayed a third time, saying the same words.

45.verse: Then He came to His disciples and said to them, “Still sleeping, and taking your rest? Behold, the hour is at hand. And the Son of Man is given into the hands of sinners.

46.verse: “Rise. Let us go. Behold, the one who betrays Me is here.”

47.verse: And while He still spoke, lo, Judas (one of the twelve) came, and with him a great multitude from the chief priests and elders of the people, with swords and clubs.

48.verse: Now the one who betrayed Him had given them a token, saying, “Whoever I shall kiss, that is Him. Take hold of Him.”

49.verse: And immediately he came to Jesus, and said, “Hail, Master”, and kissed Him.

50.verse: Then Jesus said to him, “Friend, why have you come?” Then they came and laid hands on Jesus and took Him.

51.verse: And behold, one of those who were with Jesus, stretched out his hand, and drew his sword, and struck a servant of the High Priest, and cut off his ear.

52.verse: Then Jesus said to him, “Put your sword back in its place. For all that take up the sword, shall perish with the sword.

53.verse: “Or do you think that I cannot now pray to My Father, and He will give Me more than twelve legions of angels?

54.verse: “How then would the Scriptures be fulfilled which say that it must be so?”

55.verse: At that time, Jesus said to the multitude, “You have come out as against a thief, with swords and clubs to take Me. Every day I sat among you, teaching in the Temple, and you did not take Me.

56.verse: “But all this has been done so that the Scriptures of the Prophets might be fulfilled.” Then all the disciples abandoned Him and fled.

57.verse: And they took Jesus, and led Him to Caiaphas the High Priest, where the scribes and the elders were assembled.

58.verse: And Peter followed him afar off to the High Priest’s hall and went in and sat with the servants to see the end.

59.verse: Now the chief priests and the elders, and all the whole Council sought false testimony against Jesus, to put him to death.

60.verse: But they found none. And though many false witnesses came, they still found none. But later, two false witnesses came,

61.verse: and said, “This man said, ‘I can destroy the Temple of God, and build it in three days.’”

62.verse: Then the chief priest arose, and said to Him, “You have no answer? What is the matter that these men testify against You?”

63.verse: But Jesus was silent. Then the chief priest answered, and said to him, “I demand that you swear to us by the living God: Are You the Christ, the Son of God!?”

64.verse: Jesus said to him, “You have said it. Nevertheless, I say to you, hereafter you shall see the Son of Man, sitting at the right hand of Power, and coming in the clouds of the heaven.

65.verse: Then the High Priest tore his clothes, saying, “He has blasphemed! What need do we have of witnesses anymore! Behold, now you have heard His blasphemy!

66.verse: “What do you think?” They answered, and said, “He is guilty of death!”

67.verse: “Then they spat in His face and punched Him. And others struck Him with rods,

68.verse: saying, “Prophesy to us, O Christ, Who struck you?”

69.verse: Peter sat outside in the hall. And a maid came to him, saying, “You were also with Jesus of Galilee.”

70.verse: But he denied before them all, saying, “I don’t understand what you are saying!”

71.verse: And when he went out to the porch, another saw him, and said to those who were there, “This man was also with Jesus of Nazareth!”

72.verse: And he denied it again, with an oath, saying, “I do not know the man!”

73.verse: So after a while, those who stood by came to him, and said to Peter, “Surely you are also one of them. For even your speech gives you away!”

74.verse: Then he began to curse, and to swear, saying, “I do not know the man!” And immediately, the cock crew.

75.verse: Then Peter remembered the words of Jesus, Who had said to him, “Before the cock crows you shalt deny Me three times. So, he went out and wept bitterly.

1.verse: When the morning had come, all the chief priests, and the elders of the people took counsel against Jesus, to put Him to death.

2.verse: And they led Him away, bound, and delivered Him to Pontius Pilate, the governor.

3.verse: Then, when Judas (who betrayed Him) saw that He was condemned, he repented and brought back the thirty pieces of silver to the chief priests and elders,

4.verse: saying, “I have sinned, betraying the innocent blood.” But they said, “What is that to us? You see to it.”

5.verse: And after he had thrown down the silver in the Temple, he departed, and went and hanged himself.

6.verse: And the chief priests took the silver, and said, “It is not lawful for us to put them into the treasury, because it is the price of blood.”

7.verse: And they took counsel, and bought a potter’s field with it, for the burial of strangers.

8.verse: Therefore that field is called, ‘The Field of Blood’, to this day.

9.verse: Then that which was spoken by Jeremiah the Prophet was fulfilled, which says, “And they took thirty silver pieces, the price of the One who was valued, Whom the children of Israel valued.

10.verse: And they gave it for the potter’s field, as the Lord directed me.”

11.verse: And Jesus stood before the governor, and the governor asked Him, saying, “Are You the King of the Jews?” Jesus said to him, “You say it.”

12.verse: And when He was accused by the chief priests and elders, He answered nothing.

13.verse: Then Pilate said to Him, “Do You not hear how many things they lay against You?”

14.verse: But He did not answer him, even one word; so much so that the governor marveled greatly.

15.verse: Now at the feast, the governor would deliver a prisoner to the people, whomever they desired.

16.verse: And there was at that time a notable prisoner called Barabbas.

17.verse: And gathering them together, Pilate said to them, “Which do you desire me to release - Barabbas, or Jesus, who is called Christ?”

18.verse: (For he knew well that they had delivered Him out of envy.

19.verse: Also, when he was sitting upon the judgment seat, his wife sent to him, saying, “Have nothing to do with that just Man. For I have suffered many things this day in a dream because of Him.”)

20.verse: But the chief priests and the elders had persuaded the people that they should ask for Barabbas and should destroy Jesus.

21.verse: Then the governor answered, and said to them, “Which of the two shall I release to you?” And they said, “Barabbas!”

22.verse: Pilate said to them, “Then what shall I do with Jesus, who is called Christ?” They all said to him, “Let him be crucified!”

23.verse: Then the governor said, “But what evil has he done?” Then they cried all the more, saying, “Let Him be crucified!”

24.verse: When Pilate saw that it was no use, and that it was becoming a riot, he took water and washed his hands before the multitude, saying, “I am innocent of the blood of this just Man. You see to it.”

25.verse: Then all the people answered, and said, “May His blood be upon us, and upon our children!”

26.verse: Thus, he released Barabbas to them. And he scourged Jesus and delivered Him to be crucified.

27.verse: Then the soldiers of the governor took Jesus into the common hall and gathered the whole band around Him.

28.verse: And they stripped Him and put a scarlet robe on Him.

29.verse: And they weaved together a crown of thorns, and put it upon His head, and a reed in His right hand. And they bowed their knees before Him, and mocked Him, saying, “Hail, King of the Jews!”

30.verse: And they spat on Him; and took a reed and struck Him on the head.

31.verse: Thus, after they had mocked Him, they took the robe off Him, and put His own clothes back on Him. And they led Him away to crucify Him.

32.verse: And as they came out, they found a man from Cyrene, named Simon. They compelled him to bear His cross.

33.verse: And when they came to the place called Golgotha (that is to say, ‘Place of a Skull’)

34.verse: They gave Him vinegar to drink, mixed with bitter herbs. And when He had tasted of it, He would not drink.

35.verse: And when they had crucified Him, they parted His garments, and cast lots, so that which was spoken by the Prophet might be fulfilled, “They divided My garments among them, and cast lots for My clothing.”

36.verse: And they sat and watched Him there.

37.verse: They also wrote His charge over His head, ‘THIS IS JESUS, THE KING OF THE JEWS.’

38.verse: And there were two thieves crucified with Him - one on the right hand, and another on the left.

39.verse: And those who passed by reviled Him, wagging their heads,

40.verse: and saying, “You who destroy the Temple, and build it in three days, save yourself! If you are the Son of God, come down from the cross!”

41.verse: Likewise also the chief priests, mocking Him with the scribes and elders and Pharisees, said,

42.verse: “He saved others, but He cannot save Himself! If He is the King of Israel, let Him now come down from the cross, and we will believe in Him!

43.verse: He trusted in God, let Him deliver Him now, if He will have Him! For He said, I am the Son of God!”

44.verse: The thieves who were crucified with Him also reviled Him.

45.verse: Now there was darkness over all the land, from the sixth hour to the ninth hour.

46.verse: And about the ninth hour, Jesus cried with loud voice, saying, “Eli, Eli, lama sabachthani!?”, which means, “My God, my God. Why have You forsaken Me?”

47.verse: And some of those who stood there, when they heard it, said, “This Man calls Elijah!”

48.verse: And immediately one of them ran and took a sponge, and filled it with vinegar, and put it on a reed, and gave it to Him to drink.

49.verse: Others said, “Let Him be! Let us see if Elijah will come and save Him!”

50.verse: Then Jesus cried again with a loud voice; and gave up the ghost.

51.verse: And behold, the veil of the Temple was torn in two, from the top to the bottom. And the earth quaked. And the stones were split.

52.verse: And the graves opened themselves. And many bodies of the saints, who slept, arose,

53.verse: and came out of the graves after His resurrection, and went into the Holy City, and appeared to many.

54.verse: When the centurion (and those who were watching Jesus with him) saw the earthquake, and the things which were done, they feared greatly, saying, “Truly, this was the Son of God!”

55.verse: And many women were there (observing from far away) who had followed Jesus from Galilee, ministering to Him.

56.verse: Among whom was Mary Magdalene, and Mary the mother of James and Joses, and the mother of Zebedee’s sons.

57.verse: And when evening had come, a rich man of Arimathea named Joseph came. He had also himself been Jesus’ disciple.

58.verse: He went to Pilate and asked for the body of Jesus. Then Pilate commanded the body to be delivered.

59.verse: So Joseph took the body, and wrapped it in a clean linen cloth,

60.verse: and put it in his new tomb which he had hewn out of a rock. And he rolled a great stone to the door of the sepulcher and departed.

61.verse: And there was Mary Magdalene, and the other Mary, sitting before the sepulcher.

62.verse: Now the next day (which followed the Preparation) the chief priests and Pharisees came to Pilate,

63.verse: and said, “Sir, we remember that that Deceiver said while he was still alive, ‘Within three days I will rise.’

64.verse: “Command, therefore, that the sepulcher be made secure until the third day, or else his disciples may come by night and steal Him away, and say to the people, ‘He is risen from the dead!’ So the last deception shall be worse than the first.”

65.verse: Then Pilate said to them, “You have a watch. Go and make it as secure as you can.”

66.verse: And they went, and made the sepulcher secure with the watch, and sealed the stone.

1.verse: Now at the end of the Sabbath, when the first day of the week began to dawn, Mary Magdalene and the other Mary came to see the sepulcher.

2.verse: And behold, there was a great earthquake. For the angel of the Lord descended from Heaven, and came and rolled back the stone from the door, and sat upon it.

3.verse: And his face was like lightning. And his clothing white as snow.

4.verse: And for fear of him, the keepers were astonished, and became as dead men.

5.verse: But the angel answered, and said to the women, “Do not fear. For I know that you seek Jesus, Who was crucified.

6.verse: “He is not here. For He is risen, as He said. Come, see the place where the Lord was laid.

7.verse: “And go, quickly, and tell His disciples that He is risen from the dead. And behold, He goes before you into Galilee. There you shall see Him. Lo, I have told you.”

8.verse: So they quickly departed from the sepulcher, with fear and great joy, and ran to bring His disciples word.

9.verse: And as they went to tell His disciples, behold, Jesus also met them, saying, “Rejoice!” And they came, and took Him by the feet, and worshipped Him.

10.verse: Then said Jesus to them, “Do not be afraid! Go, and tell My brothers, so that they would go into Galilee. And there they shall see Me.”

11.verse: Now when they had gone, behold, some of the guards came into the city, and reported to the chief priests all the things that had been done.

12.verse: And they gathered together with the elders, and took counsel, and gave considerable money to the soldiers,

13.verse: saying, “Say, ‘His disciples came by night and stole Him away while we slept.’

14.verse: “And if this matter comes before the governor to be heard, we will persuade him, so that you need not worry.”

15.verse: So they took the money and did as they were instructed. And this story is told among the Jews to this day.

16.verse: Then the eleven disciples went into Galilee, and to a mountain where Jesus had directed them.

17.verse: And when they saw Him, they worshipped Him. But some doubted.

18.verse: And Jesus came, and spoke to them, saying, “All power is given to Me, in Heaven, and on Earth.

19.verse: “Go therefore, and teach all nations, baptizing them in the Name of the Father, and the Son, and the Holy Ghost,

20.verse: “teaching them to observe all things, whatever I have commanded you. And lo, I am with you always, until the end of the age. Amen.”
